H0.text: By freezing the leaves on trees, freezing temperatures most likely cause weathering, as Darryl learns.

H1.text: Causing rocks to stick together is how freezing temperatures most likely cause weathering.

H2.text: By turning acid rain into acid snow, freezing temperatures most likely cause weathering.

H3.text: By freezing water in the cracks of rocks, freezing temperatures most likely cause weathering, as Darryl learns that such temperatures can facilitate the breakdown of rocks.

A4.text: At a temperature of -22 °C, ice growth is known to be able to generate pressures of up to 207 MPa, more than enough to fracture any rock.
